par.text: Neodymium, like other lanthanides, occurs naturally only in the combined state in monazite sand, which is a mixture of the phosphates of cerium, thorium, lanthanum and other lanthanides. These elements constitute 50% of monazite sand by weight. Neodymium makes up 3.8 ·
% of the Earth's crust by weight and ranks 27th in abundance.
